author: William Goetz
text:
Anyone have any thoughts or experience about the use of fingerprint scanning to verify the identity and/or drug history of patients who might receive controlled substance prescriptions, at the point of care (doctor's office), in realtime, to enhance prescription drug monitoring programs?
It would alleviate the fear of most primary care providers that they might be prescribing to abusers, diverters, or potential overdoses. It would therefore enhance the care of legitimate pain patients. 
It would also decrease crime and shut down almost immediately any pill mills and pillbillies.
Thoughts about the concept?
title: Fingerprint scanning of patients in realtime to enhance PDMPs
